reviews.review_msg: WOW this course is HARD! those that comment that this is easy course is seriously smart or in the field of Physical Geography or Geology. Those in HUMAN GEOGRAPHY stay away go with Natural Hazards 312 or Bio geography 315 if your in the field of Human Geography

Had her for 311 and 411. Great prof, very enthusiastic helpful and a very very nice person. She is very approachable and helps a lot if you see her in her office hour. The class is a bit on the easy side for a science class but that's in part because she's so good. Highly recommended even for non-science students. One of the best profs at SFU.

She's friendly and helpful; she teaches the labs and will check your answers and tell you if you've gotten something wrong so attend the labs to get hint and answers! Midterm & final reasonable with fill in the blanks, circle the right answer and short answer definitions etc. Textbook just covered exactly what she said so I opened it once.

I had 311 and 411 with her. Amazing prof all the way.  Very nice, thorough, patient when explaining even to idiots like me.  The labs are interesting and not terribly stressful.  She's also very sweet as a person.  Highly recommended course and prof.
She did one assignment at field school and, since many of us had never taken hydrology, she walked us through the questions & calculations in the evening. She's helpful and just generally nice.
